analyzed: de la thog mar lus bskyed pa ni de'i chos las de'i chos can thams cad stong pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir dang por lus bskyed pa'o //

original: de kho na'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i rang bzhin no //

original: mchog ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: mchog ni 'od gsal ba ste /

analyzed: dran pa'i sgras brjod pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du chos rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag par rnam par dag pas nub kyi sgo'o //

analyzed: de ltar yin zhes ji ltar zhe na gzugs rnam par spangs nas /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bsgrubs pa ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang skad cig ma'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par dpyad na mi bzad pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par dpyad na zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: chos gang yin pa de rnams kyis rnam par shes pa bsgrubs pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang skad cig ma'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par dpyad pas gser la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su brdungs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //

original: de'i chos med pa ni ji ltar rdzas med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i chos med pa ni ji ltar rdzas med pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad med @79b pa na rnam par shes pa med pa yin te //
translated: Thus, when all phenomena do not exist, consciousness does not exist.

original: des na rnam par shes pa yang skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa yang skad cig ma'o //

original: ji ltar gzung bya rdzas med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung bya rdzas med par 'gyur na /

original: 'dzin pa po med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po med pa ste /

analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar gzung bya dmigs nas 'dzin pa gnas shing de dag med na 'dzin pa med do //

analyzed: lhag ma'i gzugs ni sgo chen po bskyed pa rnam par dag pa las gzhan du mi shes te /

original: de ltar gyur pa'i sgo bzhi bsam par bya /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i sgo bzhi bsam par bya /

analyzed: gnyen po dang rnam par gcod pa dang / bskyed pa dang yongs su bsngo ba'o //

original: gang gi gnyen po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi gnyen po gang yin zhe na /

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote to the afflictions of desire and so on.

original: de las ma skyes pa na nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba na gnod pa byas pa de ni gnyen po'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir de rnam par nyams pa las 'di rnams med pa ste /

analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa med pa'i go 'phang skye'o //

analyzed: skyes pa de ni sems can dang lhag cig thun mong du byed par 'dod pa nyid ni yongs su bsngo ba zhes pa ste /

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pas rta babs rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pas rta babs rnams so //
translated: The archways are the purification of the four correct abandonments.

analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba yang rang bzhin de nyid kyis rang dang gzhan de'i rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi mthar thug pa nyid dngos su byed pa'o //

analyzed: de'i spro ba dang sdud pa'i sku zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dod pas rdzu 'phrul lo //

original: lnga'i rnam pa zhes pa rnam pa stong pa ste 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lnga'i rnam pa zhes pa rnam pa stong pa ste 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The five aspects are the aspect of emptiness. This is the emptiness of nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ste rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ste rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the absence of nature is the perfection of wisdom, which is the emptiness of the absence of nature.

original: brtan pa dang 'gro ba rdul phra rab kyang chos thams cad de /
analyzed: brtan pa dang 'gro ba rdul phra rab kyang chos thams cad de /
translated: The stable and the moving are the atoms of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi sgras brjod pa'i phyir gang brjod pa de thams cad stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgras brjod pa'i phyir gang brjod pa de thams cad stong pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are expressed by the word all phenomena, whatever is expressed is empty.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of non-entities?

original: 'gro ba thams cad mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ngo bo mthong ba ni rang bzhin las te /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ngo bo mthong ba ni rang bzhin las te /
translated: The seeing of the essence of all beings as like a firebrand wheel is from the nature.

original: rang bzhin ngo bo grangs pas dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bo grangs pas dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the nonexistence of things is from the nature, the essence, and the number.

original: rang bzhin zhes pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature is the emptiness of the nature.

original: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig tu gyur pa na gzugs ji ltar gyur pa lta bu ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa dag gcig tu gyur pa na gzugs ji ltar gyur pa lta bu ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: When the space element and consciousness become one, it is like the form, and is called the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.

original: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni phyag rnam par dag par rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni phyag rnam par dag par rab tu brjod do //
translated: These emptinesses are fully explained as the purity of the hands.

original: de nas zhal gyi kha dog gi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhal gyi kha dog gi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then the purity of the colors of the faces should be explained.

original: dang po'i zhal nag po ni zhe sdang gi las bsgrub pa'i don dang / dbang po rnams sgrib pa med pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: dang po'i zhal nag po ni zhe sdang gi las bsgrub pa'i don dang / dbang po rnams sgrib pa med pa'i yang ngo //
translated: The first face, which is black, is for the sake of accomplishing the karma of anger, and is also for the sake of the unobstructed faculties.

original: g-yon gyi zhal dmar po ni dbang du bya ba bsgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: g-yon gyi zhal dmar po ni dbang du bya ba bsgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The left face, which is red, is for the sake of accomplishing the subjugation.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni dbang nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gcig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni dbang nyid do //
translated: The very nature of the unity of body, speech, and mind is the empowerment itself.

original: g-yas kyi zhal dkar ba ni zhi ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal dkar ba ni zhi ba'i don to //
translated: The white face on the right is for the sake of peace.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la lha nyid kyi dag pa'i nga rgyal nyid ces bya ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la lha nyid kyi dag pa'i nga rgyal nyid ces bya ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The pride of purity as deity in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is called ‚Äúpeace.‚Äù

original: steng gi zhal mche ba gtsigs pa can du ba'i mdog ni phyi ma'i tshe na zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur pa nyams pa'i don to //
analyzed: steng gi zhal mche ba gtsigs pa can du ba'i mdog ni phyi ma'i tshe na zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur pa nyams pa'i don to //
translated: The upper face, with bared fangs and the color of smoke, is for the sake of destroying the arising of the afflictions such as hatred in future lives.

original: de bzhin du bdud bzhi rnam par nyams pa'i don du bung ba dang mtshungs pa'i zhal bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdud bzhi rnam par nyams pa'i don du bung ba dang mtshungs pa'i zhal bzhi rnams te /
translated: Likewise, the four faces that are like bees are for the sake of destroying the four mƒÅras.

original: phung po la brten pa'i nad ni phung po'i bdud dang / phung po rnams kyi phung por gyur pa ni 'chi ba'i bdud dang / sems can la gnod pa byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / de bzhin @83b du bud med la g-yo ba ni lha'i bu'i bdud du brjod do //
analyzed: phung po la brten pa'i nad ni phung po'i bdud dang / phung po rnams kyi phung por gyur pa ni 'chi ba'i bdud dang / sems can la gnod pa byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / de bzhin @83b du bud med la g-yo ba ni lha'i bu'i bdud du brjod do //
translated: The disease of the aggregates is the demon of the aggregates; the death of the aggregates is the demon of death; the harm to sentient beings is the demon of the afflictions; and the deception of women is said to be the demon of the sons of gods.

original: bdud bzhi rnams rnam par nyams pa'i don du bung ba dang mtshungs pa'i zhal bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi rnams rnam par nyams pa'i don du bung ba dang mtshungs pa'i zhal bzhi rnams so //
translated: The four faces are like bees for the purpose of destroying the four demons.

original: phyag mtshan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag mtshan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The purities of the hand implements should be stated.

original: glang po che la sogs pa gzung ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa sna tshogs nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa gzung ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa sna tshogs nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The hand implements such as the elephant are for the sake of pacifying the various afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni glo dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / de bzhin du smyo ba dang / khong skams dang / mdze dang / phol dang / skran dang / rang bzhin glang po la sogs pa de rnams yongs su brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni glo dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / de bzhin du smyo ba dang / khong skams dang / mdze dang / phol dang / skran dang / rang bzhin glang po la sogs pa de rnams yongs su brjod do //
translated: boils, tumors, and natural elephant-like ones.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa brgyad po de rnams lag par gyur pa'i sems can rnams te /
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa brgyad po de rnams lag par gyur pa'i sems can rnams te /
translated: Here, those eight afflictions are the sentient beings who have become the hands.

original: snod kyi steng du rnam par bsnams pa ni rnam par gzung ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snod kyi steng du rnam par bsnams pa ni rnam par gzung ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are held above the vessel.

original: sa la sogs pa nas nor 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa g-yon gyis bsnams pa'i phyag gi mtshan ma rnams ni dbang phyug brgyad rab tu grub pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa nas nor 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa g-yon gyis bsnams pa'i phyag gi mtshan ma rnams ni dbang phyug brgyad rab tu grub pa'i don to //
translated: The signs in the hands that hold the earth up to the end of the world-realm are the eight masteries.üîΩThe mastery of body, the mastery of speech,üîΩand likewise the mastery of mind,

original: sku yi dbang phyug gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // rdzu 'phrul can 'gro'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: sku yi dbang phyug gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // rdzu 'phrul can 'gro'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: the mastery of miracles, the mastery of going,

original: 'dod byed yon tan brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod byed yon tan brgyad pa'o //
translated: and the mastery of desire are the eight qualities.

original: zhes so // sku mtha' yas pa ni sku'i dbang phyug dang / sems can thams cad kyi skad smra bas gsung gi dbang phyug dang / sems can gyi sems shes pas thugs kyi dbang phyug dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mthong bas rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang phyug dang /
analyzed: zhes so // sku mtha' yas pa ni sku'i dbang phyug dang / sems can thams cad kyi skad smra bas gsung gi dbang phyug dang / sems can gyi sems shes pas thugs kyi dbang phyug dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mthong bas rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang phyug dang /
translated: The infinite body is the lordship of body, the lordship of speech is the speech that speaks the language of all sentient beings, the lordship of mind is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings, the lordship of miracles is the seeing of infinite world systems through miracles.

original: 'jig rten gsum gcig pa'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba'i dbang phyug dang / 'dod pas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin sems can rnams mngon par 'dod pas 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gcig pa'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba'i dbang phyug dang / 'dod pas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin sems can rnams mngon par 'dod pas 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ste /
translated: The body that is the one of the three worlds is the lordship of omnipresence, and the lordship of desire is the nature of great bliss that sentient beings desire through desire.

original: 'dod pa'i sgras 'dod pa 'dod pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras 'dod pa 'dod pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The word desire expresses the desire for desire.

original: byed pa po zhes pa ni byed pa po rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyis byed pa'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes pa ni byed pa po rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyis byed pa'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The agent is the lordship of action through the agent Vajradhara himself.

original: zab mo'i lha nyid kyi rnam pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs shing mya ngan las 'das nas lha nyid kyi rnam par rgyu bas yon tan gyi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i lha nyid kyi rnam pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar gshegs shing mya ngan las 'das nas lha nyid kyi rnam par rgyu bas yon tan gyi dbang phyug ste /
translated: The Lord of Good Qualities, because he goes to nirvana in the form of the profound deity, and after going to nirvana, moves about in the form of the deity.

original: 'dis ni mtshan ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of the signs.

original: snod rnams kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: snod rnams kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The purification of the vessels should be stated.

original: snod ni snying rje'i cha shas rab tu gsal ba yin zhing phyag rnams stong pa nyid bcu drug dag pa ste /
analyzed: snod ni snying rje'i cha shas rab tu gsal ba yin zhing phyag rnams stong pa nyid bcu drug dag pa ste /
translated: The vessels are the manifestation of the parts of compassion, and the hands are the purification of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: 'dis ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid du rab @84a * //üîΩtu gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid du rab @84a * // tu gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: This makes manifest the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: ma mo rnams kyi sangs rgyas lnga //
analyzed: ma mo rnams kyi sangs rgyas lnga //
translated: The five Buddhas of the Mothers

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of joy.

original: ma mo zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma mo zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dag pa'o //
translated: The Mothers are the consorts, the purification of the five Tathagatas.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni yongs su g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni yongs su g-yogs pa ste /
translated: The consorts are the coverings.

original: 'khor lo dang / rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / lag pa la dpung rgyan dang / ska rags dang / thal ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / lag pa la dpung rgyan dang / ska rags dang / thal ba ste /
translated: wheel, earrings, necklace, armlets on the arms, a belt, and ashes.

original: phyag rgya drug tu rab tu grags so //
analyzed: phyag rgya drug tu rab tu grags so //
translated: These are well known as the six mudras.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Mudra means right knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes pa ni gang du shes pa'i ngo bor med pa ni gang gzugs yin pa de yang dag par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes pa ni gang du shes pa'i ngo bor med pa ni gang gzugs yin pa de yang dag par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Right knowledge is that which is not an entity of knowledge, that is, form.

original: yi ge lnga bcu las byas pa phrag pa la mgo bo'i phreng ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge lnga bcu las byas pa phrag pa la mgo bo'i phreng ba ste /
translated: The garland of heads on the shoulders is made of fifty letters.

original: a'a li dang k'a li lnga bcu'i yi ge dag pas zung du 'jug pa'i lam nye bar ston pa po mgul par mgo'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li lnga bcu'i yi ge dag pas zung du 'jug pa'i lam nye bar ston pa po mgul par mgo'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The garland of heads on the neck shows the path of union by the purity of the fifty letters of the vowels and consonants.

original: da ni gar gyi ro dgu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gar gyi ro dgu brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the nine flavors of dance will be described.

original: bdag med ma dang lhan cig ro gcig pa ni sgeg pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma dang lhan cig ro gcig pa ni sgeg pa'o //
translated: The single flavor with Nairatmya is grace.

original: dur khrod na gnas pa ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: dur khrod na gnas pa ni dbang po'o //
translated: The abode in the charnel ground is heroism.

original: khro gnyer dang mtshe ba gtsigs pa ni mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer dang mtshe ba gtsigs pa ni mi sdug pa'o //
translated: The frown and bared fangs are repulsiveness.

original: 'bar ba'i 'od ni drag shul lo //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i 'od ni drag shul lo //
translated: The blazing light is the fierce one.

original: rnam par rgyas pa'i zhal ni bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyas pa'i zhal ni bzhad pa'o //
translated: The expanded face is the laughing one.

original: brlan dang bcas pa'i mgo bo'i phreng ba can ni 'jigs su rung ba'o //
analyzed: brlan dang bcas pa'i mgo bo'i phreng ba can ni 'jigs su rung ba'o //
translated: The garland of moist heads is the fearful one.

original: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i thugs ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i thugs ni snying rje'o //
translated: The mind of holding sentient beings is the compassionate one.

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The illusory form is the wondrous one.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu spangs pa nyid kyi phyir zhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu spangs pa nyid kyi phyir zhi ba ste /
translated: The peaceful one is due to the abandonment of the afflictions such as desire and so forth.

original: gar dgu po 'di rnams dang lhan cig pa'i bcom ldan 'das rgyur gyur pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gar dgu po 'di rnams dang lhan cig pa'i bcom ldan 'das rgyur gyur pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The Bhagawan is the nature of the cause together with these nine expressions.

original: dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo skam po lnga'i phreng ba rnams ni phung po lnga rnams rab tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo skam po lnga'i phreng ba rnams ni phung po lnga rnams rab tu gsal ba'o //
translated: The garland of five dry heads on the forehead is the manifestation of the five aggregates.

original: spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa ni sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa ni sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The top of the head marked with a vajra cross is for the sake of performing various activities.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzugs kyi phyir dang / dus gsum yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir zhal so so rnams la spyan gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzugs kyi phyir dang / dus gsum yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir zhal so so rnams la spyan gsum gsum mo //
translated: For the sake of the form of omniscience and for the sake of the knowledge of the three times, each face has three eyes.

original: 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mtha' dag bsreg pa'i don du dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'greng ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mtha' dag bsreg pa'i don du dbu skra dmar ser gyen du 'greng ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: For the sake of burning all the afflictions such as desire, the hair is shown standing on end.

original: chos thams cad sgrib pa med par rab tu gsal ba'i phyir gcer bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgrib pa med par rab tu gsal ba'i phyir gcer bu'o //
translated: For the sake of the illumination of all phenomena without obscuration, she is naked.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rkang pa thob pa'i phyir skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rkang pa thob pa'i phyir skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs so //
translated: For the sake of attaining the feet of the mind of enlightenment, she is in the half-crossed posture.

original: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag gcig @84b tu rab tu gsal ba'i phyir zhabs kyi mtheb mo gcig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag gcig @84b tu rab tu gsal ba'i phyir zhabs kyi mtheb mo gcig bstan pa'o //
translated: For the sake of the illumination of the entire triple world, she displays the big toe of her foot.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang skad cig mar rab tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang skad cig mar rab tu snang ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One is also clearly manifest in an instant.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma la yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma la yang ste /
translated: Just as the Blessed One, so also the Blessed Lady.

original: dbye ba yang gcig gi dbyibs kyi dbang las zhal gcig ma'o //
analyzed: dbye ba yang gcig gi dbyibs kyi dbang las zhal gcig ma'o //
translated: For the sake of the single shape, she has one face.

original: phyag g-yon na lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: phyag g-yon na lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyi khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa ste /
translated: In his left hand he holds a skull-cup filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: lha dang lha ma yin gyi sgra ci zhe na /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin gyi sgra ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of gods and demigods?

original: lha ni lus dang ngag dang yid de de'i yul ni lha ma yin no //
analyzed: lha ni lus dang ngag dang yid de de'i yul ni lha ma yin no //
translated: Gods are body, speech, and mind; their objects are demigods.

original: 'di dag gis byed pa med pa ni chags pa med par dmigs pa med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis byed pa med pa ni chags pa med par dmigs pa med par byed pa ste /
translated: They are without activity, without attachment, without reference.

original: des gang ba'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: des gang ba'i thod pa'o //
translated: The skull-cup is filled with that.

original: thod pa dang khrag dag gi gcig tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yongs su gang bar bstan to //
analyzed: thod pa dang khrag dag gi gcig tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yongs su gang bar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the skull-cup and blood is taught as the filling of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: g-yas na nyon mongs pa ma lus par gcod pa'i phyir gri gug bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: g-yas na nyon mongs pa ma lus par gcod pa'i phyir gri gug bsnams pa ste /
translated: In his right hand he holds a flaying knife in order to cut through all afflictions without exception.

original: lhag ma gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par dag pa bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gang cung zad bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par dag pa bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as the purity of the Blessed One in any way whatsoever.

original: da ni bsgrub bya'i dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lus la 'khor lo bzhi bsam ste /
analyzed: da ni bsgrub bya'i dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa'i lus la 'khor lo bzhi bsam ste /
translated: Now, the pledge being accomplished, one should think of the four wheels in the body of the vajra-holder.

original: sprul pa dang por byas nas chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: sprul pa dang por byas nas chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang bde ba chen po ste /
translated: Having made the emanation the first, there are the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, the Emanation Body, and the Great Bliss Body.

original: sku bzhi rnam par dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: sku bzhi rnam par dag pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the four pure bodies.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor ba'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor ba'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the purity of the mandala should be stated.

original: goo r'i nag mo ni bdud kyi gdul bya'i sems can rab tu bsad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goo r'i nag mo ni bdud kyi gdul bya'i sems can rab tu bsad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The black Gaurƒ´ is for the sake of killing the sentient beings who are to be converted by MƒÅra.

original: g-yas kyi lag pa na log par lta ba gcod pa'i phyir gri gug gzung zhing /
